sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A commemoration, or A calling to minde of the great and eminent deliverance from the powder-plot. A mercie never to be forgotten by the people of God, who have been, still are, and ever will be, the greatest sharers in it, and the best imp[r]overs of it. Turner, John, fl. 1654.
[2], 6 p.
Printed by J.B. and are to be sold by John Collins dwelling in Little-Britain over against S. Buttolphs Church., London : 1654.
"To the reader" signed: John Turner. In verse. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 10th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library. In the title, the r in "inprovers" has failed to print.
=======
A commemoration, or A calling to minde of the great and eminent deliverance from the powder-plot. A mercie never to be forgotten by the people of God, who have been, still are, and ever will be, the greatest sharers in it, and the best imp[r]overs of it. Turner, John, fl. 1654.
[2], 6 p.
Printed by J.B. and are to be sold by John Collins dwelling in Little-Britain over against S. Buttolphs Church., London : 1654.
"To the reader" signed: John Turner. In verse. Annotation on Thomason copy: "8ber [i.e. October] 10th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library. In the title, the r in "inprovers" has failed to print.
John Collins
J.B.
Little-Britain over against S. Buttolphs Church.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
